headline: Caterpillar Inc. (CAT): Among the Stocks Analysts Are Upgrading Today
summary: We recently compiled a list of the 10 Stocks Analysts Are Upgrading Today. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE:CAT) stands against the other stocks analysts are upgrading today. The easing of the US-China trade war is the catalyst driving equity markets higher after weeks of heightened volatility. […]

headline: Caterpillar Showcases Machinery that has Built America for 100 Years in Celebration of Construction
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE: CAT) today is showcasing its innovative and iconic iron at the National Mall as part of the Association of Equipment Manufacturers (AEM) Celebration of Construction. The U.S.-based company is highlighting how its products, technology and services have helped customers for 100 years.

headline: You can't manage risk if you don't know what you're holding
summary: You can catch Trader Talk on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. In the latest episode of "Trader Talk," Kenny Polcari sits down with Mark Malek, chief investment officer of SiebertNXT, to explore how quantitative investing and clear investment theses can help investors navigate today's volatile markets. Malek emphasizes using data-driven models to cut through noise, avoid over-diversification, and focus on high-probability opportunities, especially in defensive sectors. The two also weigh in on rate-cut expectations, soft versus hard data, and why sticking to fundamentals matters more than ever. Watch more episodes of Trader Talk here. Trader Talk with Kenny Polcari on Yahoo Finance delivers expert analysis and actionable insights, empowering you to navigate market volatility and secure your financial future.

headline: Construction Machinery Stocks Q1 In Review: Manitowoc (NYSE:MTW) Vs Peers
summary: As the Q1 earnings season comes to a close, it’s time to take stock of this quarter’s best and worst performers in the construction machinery industry, including Manitowoc (NYSE:MTW) and its peers.
